title: Liberty Ellman - Radiate (2015)
description:
Pi Recordings: Pi60 
http://www.pirecordings.com/album/pi60

* Liberty Ellman: guitar
* Steve Lehman: alto saxophone
* Jonathan Finlayson: trumpet
* Jose Davila: tuba, trombone
* Stephan Crump: bass; Damion Reid: drums
 
http://www.libertyellman.com/ 
http://www.stevelehman.com/ 
http://www.jonathanfinlayson.com/ 
http://www.allmusic.com/artist/jose-davila-mn0001295294 
http://www.stephancrump.com/ 
http://www.damionreid.com/

Recorded by Derek Nievergelt at Systems Two Studios,
Brooklyn, NY, on November 3 and 4, 2014.


Reviews
~~~~~~~

By George W. Harris 
http://www.jazzweekly.com/2015/09/liberty-ellman-radiate/

Guitarist Liberty Ellman creates a warm and flexible band, employing both
Stephan Crumpâ€™s bass and Jose Davilaâ€™s tuba as foundations along with drummer
Damon Reid to serve the variant rhythms. The front line of Ellman, Steve
Lehman/as, Jonathan Finlayson/tp and Davilaâ€™s trombone. The team bounces freely
on pieces like the funky â€œSupercellâ€ as the staccato horns work well with
Ellmanâ€™s guitar, while the leader gets a bit edgy on the dials as he ruminates
on â€œFurthermore.â€ The Lehman and Davila merrily skip along on â€œRhinocerismsâ€
and Reidâ€™s cymbals do the talking on a free form quickie â€œMoment Twice.â€ The
team gets a bit angular with alto and guitar in the front lines on â€œSkeletopeâ€
and Crump enjoys his moment in the sun on the gently driving â€œVibrograph.â€
Elastic workings in abundance here, with a sharp display of the guitar in many
a milieu.

--
